paper_abstract: Let Gamma = (V, E) be a point-symmetric reflexive relation and let upsilon epsilon V such that |Gamma(nu)| is finite (and hence |Gamma(x)| is finite for all x, by the transitive action of the group of automorphisms). Let j epsilon N be an integer such that Gamma(j)(upsilon) boolean AND Gamma-(upsilon) = {upsilon}. Our main result states that |Gamma j(nu)| >= |Gamma(j-1)(nu)| + |Gamma(nu)| - 1. As an application we have |Gamma(j)(upsilon)| >=, 1 + (|Gamma(upsilon)| - 1)j. The last result confirms a recent conjecture of Seymour in the case of vertex-symmetric graphs. Also it gives a short proof for the validity of the Caccetta-Haggkvist conjecture for vertex-symmetric graphs and generalizes an additive result of Shepherdson.
paper_title: On iterated image size for point-symmetric relations
